1→# Research: ISS Tracker Migration
     2→
     3→**Feature**: 001-iss-tracker-migration  
     4→**Created**: December 13, 2025
     5→
     6→## Research Summary
     7→
     8→This document captures decisions made during the planning phase for migrating the ISS Tracker to ephemeris.
     9→
    10→---
    11→
    12→## 1. TanStack Start Routing Pattern
    13→
    14→**Decision**: Use file-based nested routes under `src/routes/iss/`
    15→
    16→**Rationale**: 
    17→- TanStack Start uses file-based routing where each file in `routes/` becomes a route
    18→- Nested routes are achieved through folder structure (`iss/index.tsx`, `iss/map.tsx`, `iss/crew.tsx`)
    19→- This matches the existing ephemeris pattern (see `routes/demo/` folder)
    20→- Route layout can be shared via an `iss/_layout.tsx` or by wrapping in a common component
    21→
    22→**Alternatives Considered**:
    23→- Single route with internal tabs: Rejected because spec requires distinct URLs (`/iss`, `/iss/map`, `/iss/crew`)
    24→- Route group with `(iss)` folder: Not necessary; direct folder works
    25→
    26→---
    27→
    28→## 2. Tailwind v4 Compatibility
    29→
    30→**Decision**: Add ISS Matrix theme colors using CSS custom properties in `:root` and `@theme inline` blocks
    31→
    32→**Rationale**:
    33→- Tailwind v4 uses `@theme inline` for custom theme values (seen in existing `styles.css`)
    34→- Matrix theme requires custom colors: `--matrix-bg`, `--matrix-text`, `--matrix-dim`, `--matrix-alert`
    35→- CSS animations (scanlines, CRT flicker, glitch) can be defined in `@keyframes` blocks
    36→- Using CSS properties allows scoping the theme to the ISS section only
    37→
    38→**Implementation**:
    39→```css
    40→/* ISS Matrix Theme */
    41→.iss-theme {
    42→  --matrix-bg: #0a0a0a;
    43→  --matrix-text: #00ff41;
    44→  --matrix-dim: #004d14;
    45→  --matrix-alert: #ff3333;
    46→}
    47→
    48→@theme inline {
    49→  --color-matrix-bg: var(--matrix-bg);
    50→  --color-matrix-text: var(--matrix-text);
    51→  --color-matrix-dim: var(--matrix-dim);
    52→  --color-matrix-alert: var(--matrix-alert);
    53→}
    54→```
    55→
    56→**Alternatives Considered**:
    57→- Separate CSS file for ISS: Rejected to maintain single source of truth for Tailwind config
    58→- Inline styles: Rejected for maintainability
    59→
    60→---
    61→
    62→## 3. Component Migration Strategy
    63→
    64→**Decision**: Selective shadcn adoption - form inputs from shadcn, custom display components
    65→
    66→**Rationale**:
    67→- Spec explicitly states: "use shadcn for form inputs (Input, Button) with Matrix theme styling"
    68→- Display components (StatsPanel, MatrixText, crew cards) must be "custom-built to preserve exact visual design"
    69→- The existing ISS Tracker components are well-structured and can be adapted directly
    70→- MatrixText animation effect is unique and not available in shadcn
    71→
    72→**Components to Create**:
    73→| Component | Source | Strategy |
    74→|-----------|--------|----------|
    75→| ISSLayout | New | Wrap routes with Matrix theme, header, footer |
    76→| StatsPanel | Migrate | Direct port with Tailwind v4 classes |
    77→| MatrixText | Migrate | Direct port (animation logic) |
    78→| FlyoverControl | Migrate | Direct port, use shadcn Button for CTA |
    79→| OrbitalSolver | Migrate | Direct port (modal with calculations) |
    80→| CrewCard | Extract from Crew.tsx | Separate component for reuse |
    81→
    82→---
    83→
    84→## 4. Sentry Instrumentation Pattern
    85→
    86→**Decision**: Wrap external API calls in `Sentry.startSpan` as specified in `.cursorrules`
    87→
    88→**Rationale**:
    89→- Ephemeris uses `@sentry/tanstackstart-react` (already configured in `router.tsx`)
    90→- The `.cursorrules` file provides the exact pattern to follow
    91→- Need to instrument: ISS position fetch, TLE fetch, crew data fetch
    92→
    93→**Implementation Pattern**:
    94→```typescript
    95→import * as Sentry from '@sentry/tanstackstart-react'
    96→
    97→export const fetchISSPosition = async (): Promise<ISSPosition> => {
    98→  return Sentry.startSpan({ name: 'Fetching ISS Position' }, async () => {
    99→    const response = await fetch(WTIA_API);
   100→    // ... rest of implementation
   101→  });
   102→};
   103→```
   104→
   105→---
   106→
   107→## 5. External Dependencies
   108→
   109→**Decision**: Add three.js, react-globe.gl, satellite.js as dependencies
   110→
   111→**Rationale**:
   112→- These are already used in the source ISS Tracker project
   113→- react-globe.gl requires three.js as a peer dependency
   114→- satellite.js is needed for TLE parsing and orbital calculations
   115→- All are mature, well-maintained libraries
   116→
   117→**Package Additions**:
   118→```json
   119→{
   120→  "dependencies": {
   121→    "three": "0.170.0",
   122→    "react-globe.gl": "^2.37.0", 
   123→    "satellite.js": "5.0.0"
   124→  }
   125→}
   126→```
   127→
   128→---
   129→
   130→## 6. Web Audio API Pattern
   131→
   132→**Decision**: Migrate TerminalAudio class with lazy initialization pattern
   133→
   134→**Rationale**:
   135→- Web Audio API requires user gesture to initialize (browser security)
   136→- The existing pattern handles this with `resume()` method on first interaction
   137→- Mute state persisted to localStorage
   138→- Sound effects enhance the Matrix terminal experience
   139→
   140→**Key Behaviors to Preserve**:
   141→- Audio context created lazily on first init
   142→- Startup sound plays on "INITIALIZE_UPLINK" click
   143→- Hover/click sounds on interactive elements
   144→- Data update sound when position refreshes
   145→
   146→---
   147→
   148→## 7. react-globe.gl Integration
   149→
   150→**Decision**: Use Globe component with custom point, ring, and path layers
   151→
   152→**Rationale**:
   153→- react-globe.gl provides a React wrapper for three-globe
   154→- It supports the required features: pointsData, ringsData, pathsData
   155→- Performance is acceptable for real-time 5-second updates
   156→- The library handles WebGL context and camera controls
   157→
   158→**Configuration Needed**:
   159→- Globe background: `//unpkg.com/three-globe/example/img/night-sky.png`
   160→- Earth texture: `//unpkg.com/three-globe/example/img/earth-night.jpg`
   161→- Atmosphere color: Matrix green (#00FF41)
   162→- Custom point styling for ISS marker and user location
   163→
   164→---
   165→
   166→## 8. Data Fetching with TanStack Query (TanStack DB Ready)
   167→
   168→**Decision**: Wrap ALL external API calls with TanStack Query; structure data for future `queryCollectionOptions` migration
   169→
   170→**Rationale**:
   171→- TanStack Query is already configured in ephemeris (`@tanstack/react-query`)
   172→- `@tanstack/query-db-collection` is already installed in ephemeris
   173→- TanStack DB's `queryCollectionOptions` uses identical `queryKey` and `queryFn` interface
   174→- Existing patterns in `src/db-collections/` and `src/hooks/demo.useChat.ts` demonstrate the target architecture
   175→
   176→**Critical Requirements for TanStack DB Compatibility**:
   177→
   178→1. **Every entity needs a unique `id` field** - Required for `getKey: (item) => item.id`
   179→2. **Collection queries must return arrays** - TanStack DB collections expect `queryFn` to return `T[]`
   180→3. **Singleton data (like current position) uses different pattern** - Not a collection, use `useLiveQuery` with single-item lookup
   181→4. **Zod schemas for validation** - Match existing ephemeris pattern in `src/db-collections/index.ts`
   182→
   183→**Architecture for TanStack DB Readiness**:
   184→
   185→```typescript
   186→// src/lib/iss/queries.ts
   187→// Phase 1: TanStack Query only (current implementation)
   188→
   189→export const issQueries = {
   190→  // COLLECTION: Returns array of positions (for history)
   191→  positionHistory: () => ({
   192→    queryKey: ['iss', 'positions'] as const,
   193→    queryFn: fetchISSPositionHistory,  // Returns ISSPosition[]
   194→    refetchInterval: 5000,
   195→  }),
   196→  
   197→  // SINGLETON: Current position (latest only)
   198→  currentPosition: () => ({
   199→    queryKey: ['iss', 'position', 'current'] as const,
   200→    queryFn: fetchISSPosition,  // Returns ISSPosition
   201→    refetchInterval: 5000,
   202→  }),
   203→  
   204→  // COLLECTION: TLE data with timestamps
   205→  tle: () => ({
   206→    queryKey: ['iss', 'tle'] as const,
   207→    queryFn: fetchTLE,
   208→    staleTime: 1000 * 60 * 60,
   209→  }),
   210→  
   211→  // COLLECTION: Crew members
   212→  crew: () => ({
   213→    queryKey: ['iss', 'crew'] as const,
   214→    queryFn: fetchCrewData,  // Returns Astronaut[]
   215→    staleTime: 1000 * 60 * 60,
   216→  }),
   217→};
   218→```
   219→
   220→```typescript
   221→// Future Phase 2: TanStack DB migration
   222→// src/db-collections/iss.ts
   223→
   224→import { createCollection } from '@tanstack/db'
   225→import { queryCollectionOptions } from '@tanstack/query-db-collection'
   226→import { z } from 'zod'
   227→
   228→const ISSPositionSchema = z.object({
   229→  id: z.string(),  // Generated: `${timestamp}` or UUID
   230→  latitude: z.number(),
   231→  longitude: z.number(),
   232→  timestamp: z.number(),
   233→  altitude: z.number(),
   234→  velocity: z.number(),
   235→  visibility: z.string(),
   236→})
   237→
   238→export const issPositionsCollection = createCollection(
   239→  queryCollectionOptions({
   240→    queryKey: ['iss', 'positions'],  // Same key as Phase 1!
   241→    queryFn: fetchISSPositionHistory,
   242→    queryClient,
   243→    getKey: (position) => position.id,
   244→    schema: ISSPositionSchema,
   245→  })
   246→)
   247→
   248→// Components stay the same - just swap useQuery for useLiveQuery
   249→```
   250→
   251→**Query Configuration**:
   252→| Query Key | Returns | Refetch | Future Collection |
   253→|-----------|---------|---------|-------------------|
   254→| `['iss', 'position', 'current']` | `ISSPosition` | 5s | Derived from `issPosition

entries.content:
Perfect! ✅ **Subtask 1.1 completed successfully!**

## Summary

I've completed the research phase for TanStack DB collection patterns and documented comprehensive findings in `.auto-claude/specs/003-tanstack-db-migration/research.md`.

### What was accomplished:

✅ **Collection Creation Patterns** - Documented how to create collections using `queryCollectionOptions` with:
- Required parameters: `queryKey`, `queryFn`, `queryClient`, `getKey`
- Optional parameters: `schema`, `enabled`, `refetchInterval`, `staleTime`
- Complete code examples for ISS data types

✅ **Dexie Adapter Configuration** - Documented the `tanstack-dexie-db-collection` package with:
- Installation and setup instructions
- Configuration options: `id`, `dbName`, `tableName`, `syncBatchSize`, `rowUpdateMode`
- Lazy initialization pattern for Cloudflare Workers compatibility
- Data transformation using `codec` for parse/serialize
- Utility methods: `getTable()`, `refresh()`, `refetch()`, `bulkInsertLocally()`

✅ **useLiveQuery Hook Patterns** - Documented reactive query patterns with:
- Basic syntax and query builder methods
- Filtering with `where()`, sorting with `orderBy()`, selecting with `select()`
- Dependency arrays for conditional re-execution
- Return object properties: `data`, `status`, `isLoading`, `isEnabled`

✅ **Sync Handler Patterns** - Documented background synchronization with:
- Sync handler functions for fetching and inserting API data
- Sync manager pattern for coordinating multiple data sources
- React integration with lifecycle hooks
- Bulk insert patterns and error handling with retry logic

### Git Commit:
```
b28040c auto-claude: 1.1 - Research TanStack DB collection API, Dexie adapter
```

The research documentation provides a complete foundation for implementing the remaining subtasks in Phase 1 (creating the actual collections) and beyond.
I'll help you implement subtask 1.2 to create a TanStack DB collection for ISS position data. Let me start by understanding the context and patterns.

1→# TanStack DB Research Documentation 2→ 3→**Task**: 003-tanstack-db-migration 4→**Subtask**: 1.1 - Research TanStack DB collection patterns 5→**Date**: 2026-01-02 6→ 7→## Overview 8→ 9→This document captures the research findings for migrating from TanStack Query + Dexie to unified TanStack DB collections with Dexie adapter for reactive, consistent data management. 10→ 11→--- 12→ 13→## 1. Collection Creation Patterns 14→ 15→### Basic Collection Structure 16→ 17→TanStack DB collections combine two packages: 18→- `@tanstack/react-db` - Core collection and query framework 19→- `@tanstack/query-db-collection` - TanStack Query integration 20→ 21→**Standard Pattern**: 22→ 23→```typescript 24→import { createCollection } from "@tanstack/react-db" 25→import { queryCollectionOptions } from "@tanstack/query-db-collection" 26→import { z } from "zod" 27→ 28→const ISSPositionSchema = z.object({ 29→ id: z.string(), 30→ latitude: z.number(), 31→ longitude: z.number(), 32→ timestamp: z.number(), 33→ altitude: z.number(), 34→ velocity: z.number(), 35→ visibility: z.string(), 36→}) 37→ 38→const positionsCollection = createCollection( 39→ queryCollectionOptions({ 40→ queryKey: ["iss", "positions"], 41→ queryFn: async () => { 42→ const response = await fetch("/api/iss/positions") 43→ return response.json() 44→ }, 45→ queryClient, 46→ getKey: (item) => item.id, 47→ schema: ISSPositionSchema, 48→ }) 49→) 50→``` 51→ 52→### Required Parameters 53→ 54→| Parameter | Type | Description | 55→|-----------|------|-------------| 56→| `queryKey` | `string[]` | TanStack Query key identifying cached data | 57→| `queryFn` | `() => Promise` | Async function fetching data from source | 58→| `queryClient` | `QueryClient` | TanStack Query client instance | 59→| `getKey` | `(item: T) => string` | Function extracting unique ID from items | 60→ 61→### Optional Parameters 62→ 63→| Parameter | Type | Description | 64→|-----------|------|-------------| 65→| `schema` | `ZodSchema` | Validates item structure and enables type inference | 66→| `enabled` | `boolean` | Controls automatic query execution | 67→| `refetchInterval` | `number` | Sets polling frequency (milliseconds) | 68→| `staleTime` | `number` | Defines data freshness duration (milliseconds) | 69→| `meta` | `object` | Custom context passed to queryFn | 70→ 71→--- 72→ 73→## 2. Dexie Adapter Configuration 74→ 75→### Installation 76→ 77→The project already has these dependencies installed: 78→```json 79→{ 80→ "@tanstack/query-db-collection": "^0.2.0", 81→ "@tanstack/react-db": "^0.1.1" 82→} 83→``` 84→ 85→**Third-party Dexie Adapter**: 86→```bash 87→npm install tanstack-dexie-db-collection 88→``` 89→ 90→### Dexie Collection Pattern 91→ 92→The `tanstack-dexie-db-collection` package provides `dexieCollectionOptions()` for IndexedDB persistence: 93→ 94→```typescript 95→import { createCollection } from "@tanstack/react-db" 96→import { dexieCollectionOptions } from "tanstack-dexie-db-collection" 97→import { z } from "zod" 98→ 99→const todoSchema = z.object({ 100→ id: z.string(), 101→ text: z.string(), 102→ completed: z.boolean(), 103→}) 104→ 105→const todosCollection = createCollection( 106→ dexieCollectionOptions({ 107→ id: "todos", 108→ schema: todoSchema, 109→ getKey: (item) => item.id, 110→ }) 111→) 112→``` 113→ 114→### Dexie Configuration Options 115→ 116→| Option | Type | Default | Description | 117→|--------|------|---------|-------------| 118→| `id` | `string` | **required** | Unique collection identifier (also table name) | 119→| `getKey` | `function` | **required** | Extracts unique key from items | 120→| `schema` | `ZodSchema` | **required** | Enables type inference and validation | 121→| `dbName` | `string` | `'app-db'` | Database name in IndexedDB | 122→| `tableName` | `string` | `id` value | Dexie table name (defaults to id) | 123→| `syncBatchSize` | `number` | `1000` | Items loaded per batch during sync | 124→| `rowUpdateMode` | `'partial' \| 'full'` | `'partial'` | Update strategy (partial merge vs full replace) | 125→| `ackTimeoutMs` | `number` | `2000` | Acknowledgment tracking window | 126→| `awaitTimeoutMs` | `number` | `10000` | ID waiting period timeout | 127→ 128→### Data Transformation with Codec 129→ 130→Transform data between storage and in-memory formats: 131→ 132→```typescript 133→codec: { 134→ parse: (stored) => ({ 135→ ...stored, 136→ date: new Date(stored.date) 137→ }), 138→ serialize: (item) => ({ 139→ ...item, 140→ date: item.date.toISOString() 141→ }) 142→} 143→``` 144→ 145→### Lazy Initialization Pattern 146→ 147→For Cloudflare Workers compatibility (matches existing `db.ts` pattern): 148→ 149→```typescript 150→// Shared Dexie database instance 151→let _db: Dexie | null = null 152→ 153→function getDb(): Dexie { 154→ if (typeof window === "undefined") { 155→ throw new Error("Database can only be accessed in browser environment") 156→ } 157→ 158→ if (!_db) { 159→ _db = new Dexie("ephemeris-iss") 160→ _db.version(1).stores({ 161→ positions: "id, timestamp", 162→ crew: "id, fetchedAt", 163→ tle: "id, fetchedAt", 164→ briefings: "passId, timestamp", 165→ }) 166→ } 167→ 168→ return _db 169→} 170→ 171→// Create collection with lazy DB initialization 172→const positionsCollection = createCollection( 173→ dexieCollectionOptions({ 174→ id: "positions", 175→ schema: ISSPositionSchema, 176→ getKey: (item) => item.id, 177→ dbName: "ephemeris-iss", 178→ tableName: "positions", 179→ }) 180→) 181→``` 182→ 183→### Utility Methods 184→ 185→Access helpers via `collection.utils`: 186→ 187→```typescript 188→// Direct Dexie table access 189→const table = positionsCollection.utils.getTable() 190→ 191→// Force live query refresh 192→positionsCollection.utils.refresh() 193→ 194→// Async refresh with processing guarantee 195→await positionsCollection.utils.refetch() 196→ 197→// Generate sequential IDs (auto-initializes from max) 198→const nextId = await positionsCollection.utils.getNextId() 199→ 200→// Bulk insert from server (bootstrap) 201→await positionsCollection.utils.bulkInsertLocally(items) 202→``` 203→ 204→--- 205→ 206→## 3. useLiveQuery Hook Patterns 207→ 208→### Basic Usage 209→ 210→The `useLiveQuery` hook creates reactive queries that auto-update on data changes: 211→ 212→```typescript 213→import { useLiveQuery } from "@tanstack/react-db" 214→ 215→function PositionDisplay() { 216→ const { data, status, isLoading } = useLiveQuery((q) => 217→ q.from({ position: positionsCollection }) 218→ ) 219→ 220→ if (isLoading) return
Loading...
221→ 222→ return
{data?.latitude}
223→} 224→``` 225→ 226→### Query Builder Methods 227→ 228→**from()** - Specify source collection(s): 229→```typescript 230→q.from({ pos: positionsCollection }) 231→``` 232→ 233→**where()** - Filter records: 234→```typescript 235→q 236→ .from({ pos: positionsCollection }) 237→ .where(({ pos }) => eq(pos.visibility, "daylight")) 238→``` 239→ 240→**select()** - Transform results: 241→```typescript 242→q 243→ .from({ pos: positionsCollection }) 244→ .select(({ pos }) => ({ 245→ lat: pos.latitude, 246→ lng: pos.longitude 247→ })) 248→``` 249→ 250→**orderBy()** - Sort results: 251→```typescript 252→q 253→ .from({ pos: positionsCollection }) 254→ .orderBy(({ pos }) => pos.timestamp, "desc") 255→``` 256→ 257→**findOne()** - Return single result: 258→```typescript 259→q 260→ .from({ pos: positionsCollection }) 261→ .orderBy(({ pos }) => pos.timestamp, "desc") 262→ .findOne() 263→``` 264→ 265→### Dependency Array 266→ 267→Like `useEffect`, re-run query when dependencies change: 268→ 269→```typescript 270→const { data } = useLiveQuery((q) => 271→ q 272→ .from({ pos: positionsCollection }) 273→ .where(({ pos }) => gte(pos.timestamp, startTime)) 274→, [startTime]) 275→``` 276→ 277→### Conditional Queries 278→ 279→Disable queries by returning `undefined`: 280→ 281→```typescript 282→const { data, isEnabled } = useLiveQuery((q) => { 283→ if (!userId) return undefined 284→ 285→ return q 286→ .from({ crew: crewCollection }) 287→ .where(({ crew }) => eq(crew.userId, userId)) 288→}, [userId]) 289→``` 290→ 291→When disabled: `isEnabled = false` and `data = undefined` 292→ 293→### Return Object Properties 294→ 295→| Property | Type | Description | 296→|----------|------|-------------| 297→| `data` | `T[] \| T \| undefined` | Query results (array or single with findOne) | 298→| `status` | `'success' \| 'error' \| 'disabled'` | Query state | 299→| `isLoading` | `boolean` | True during initial load | 300→| `isEnabled` | `boolean` | Whether query is active | 301→| `error` | `Error \| null` | Error object if query failed | 302→ 303→--- 304→ 305→## 4. Sync Handler Patterns for API Data 306→ 307→### Background Sync Architecture 308→ 309→TanStack DB collections can sync with external APIs using background intervals. The pattern involves: 310→ 311→1. **Sync Handler Function** - Fetches from API and inserts into collection 312→2. **Sync Manager** - Coordinates intervals for multiple data types 313→3. **Lifecycle Integration** - Start/stop on mount/unmount 314→ 315→### Sync ... ## ✅ Subtask 1.2 Complete

I've successfully created the TanStack DB collection for ISS position data. Here's what was accomplished:

### Files Created
- **`src/lib/iss/collections/positions.ts`** - Position collection with Dexie adapter

### Key Features Implemented
✅ **Proper type definitions** - Zod schema with full validation for ISSPosition  
✅ **Dexie adapter configuration** - Configured for 'positions' table in 'ephemeris-iss' database  
✅ **Lazy initialization** - Compatible with Cloudflare Workers via dexieCollectionOptions  
✅ **getKey function** - Returns position.id as required  

### Dependencies Updated
- Installed `tanstack-dexie-db-collection@0.1.4`
- Added npm overrides to force `@tanstack/db@0.5.12` across all packages to resolve version conflicts

### Verification
- TypeScript compilation passes with no errors
- All acceptance criteria met
- Clean git commit created

The collection is now ready to be used in Phase 2 for implementing sync handlers and in Phase 3 for creating live query hooks.

1→/**
     2→ * ISS Position Collection
     3→ *
     4→ * TanStack DB collection for ISS position data with Dexie adapter for IndexedDB persistence.
     5→ * Provides reactive queries and automatic cross-tab synchronization.
     6→ */
     7→
     8→import { createCollection } from "@tanstack/react-db";
     9→import { dexieCollectionOptions } from "tanstack-dexie-db-collection";
    10→import { z } from "zod";
    11→
    12→// =============================================================================
    13→// SCHEMA DEFINITION
    14→// =============================================================================
    15→
    16→/**
    17→ * Zod schema for ISS position validation and type inference
    18→ */
    19→export const ISSPositionSchema = z.object({
    20→	/** Unique identifier for TanStack DB (timestamp-based) */
    21→	id: z.string(),
    22→	/** Latitude in degrees (-90 to 90) */
    23→	latitude: z.number().min(-90).max(90),
    24→	/** Longitude in degrees (-180 to 180) */
    25→	longitude: z.number().min(-180).max(180),
    26→	/** Unix timestamp in seconds */
    27→	timestamp: z.number().positive(),
    28→	/** Altitude above Earth's surface in kilometers */
    29→	altitude: z.number().positive(),
    30→	/** Orbital velocity in kilometers per hour */
    31→	velocity: z.number().positive(),
    32→	/** Current lighting condition */
    33→	visibility: z.string(),
    34→});
    35→
    36→// =============================================================================
    37→// COLLECTION DEFINITION
    38→// =============================================================================
    39→
    40→/**
    41→ * TanStack DB collection for ISS positions with Dexie persistence
    42→ *
    43→ * Features:
    44→ * - Lazy initialization for Cloudflare Workers compatibility
    45→ * - IndexedDB persistence via Dexie adapter
    46→ * - Automatic schema validation with Zod
    47→ * - Reactive queries with useLiveQuery
    48→ * - Cross-tab synchronization
    49→ *
    50→ * Database configuration:
    51→ * - Database: "ephemeris-iss"
    52→ * - Table: "positions"
    53→ * - Primary key: id (timestamp-based)
    54→ * - Index: timestamp (for range queries)
    55→ */
    56→export const positionsCollection = createCollection(
    57→	dexieCollectionOptions({
    58→		id: "positions",
    59→		schema: ISSPositionSchema,
    60→		getKey: (item) => item.id,
    61→		dbName: "ephemeris-iss",
    62→		tableName: "positions",
    63→	}),
    64→);
    65→

## ✅ Subtask 1.4 Completed: TLE Collection with Dexie Persistence

### Implementation Details:
1. **Zod Schema** - `StoredTLESchema` with proper validation:
   - `id`: string (unique identifier in format "tle-timestamp")
   - `line1`: string (first TLE line)
   - `line2`: string (second TLE line)

   - `source`: enum ["celestrak", "ariss", "fallback"]

2. **TanStack DB Collection** - `tleCollection` configured with:
   - Dexie adapter for IndexedDB persistence
   - Database: "ephemeris-iss"

   - Lazy initialization for Cloudflare Workers compatibility

     6→ */
     7→
     8→import { createCollection } from "@tanstack/react-db";
     9→import { dexieCollectionOptions } from "tanstack-dexie-db-collection";

    11→

    13→// SCHEMA DEFINITION
    14→// =============================================================================
    15→
    16→/**
    17→ * Zod schema for ISS position validation and type inference
    18→ */
    19→export const ISSPositionSchema = z.object({
    20→	/** Unique identifier for TanStack DB (timestamp-based) */
    21→	id: z.string(),
    22→	/** Latitude in degrees (-90 to 90) */
    23→	latitude: z.number().min(-90).max(90),
    24→	/** Longitude in degrees (-180 to 180) */
    25→	longitude: z.number().min(-180).max(180),
    26→	/** Unix timestamp in seconds */
    27→	timestamp: z.number().positive(),
    28→	/** Altitude above Earth's surface in kilometers */
    29→	altitude: z.number().positive(),
    30→	/** Orbital velocity in kilometers per hour */
    31→	velocity: z.number().positive(),
    32→	/** Current lighting condition */
    33→	visibility: z.string(),
    34→});
    35→
    36→// =============================================================================

    41→ * TanStack DB collection for ISS positions with Dexie persistence

    43→ * Features:

1→/**
     2→ * API Contracts: AI Pass Briefing
     3→ *
     4→ * TypeScript interfaces and Zod schemas for the AI Pass Briefing feature.
     5→ * These contracts define the shape of data exchanged between components,
     6→ * APIs, and storage layers.
     7→ *
     8→ * Feature Branch: 006-ai-pass-briefing
     9→ * Date: 2024-12-17
    10→ */
    11→
    12→import { z } from "zod";
    13→
    14→// =============================================================================
    15→// CORE DOMAIN ENTITIES
    16→// =============================================================================
    17→
    18→/**
    19→ * User's observation location with persistence metadata
    20→ */
    21→export const UserLocationSchema = z.object({
    22→	id: z.string().uuid(),
    23→	coordinates: z.object({
    24→		lat: z.number().min(-90).max(90),
    25→		lng: z.number().min(-180).max(180),
    26→	}),
    27→	displayName: z.string().max(100).nullable(),
    28→	source: z.enum(["geolocation", "manual", "search"]),
    29→	lastUpdated: z.number().positive(),
    30→});
    31→
    32→export type UserLocation = z.infer<typeof UserLocationSchema>;
    33→
    34→/**
    35→ * Simplified location for calculations (coordinates only)
    36→ */
    37→export const LatLngSchema = z.object({
    38→	lat: z.number().min(-90).max(90),
    39→	lng: z.number().min(-180).max(180),
    40→});
    41→
    42→export type LatLng = z.infer<typeof LatLngSchema>;
    43→
    44→/**
    45→ * Point on orbital trajectory
    46→ */
    47→export const OrbitalPointSchema = z.object({
    48→	lat: z.number(),
    49→	lng: z.number(),
    50→	alt: z.number().positive(),
    51→});
    52→
    53→export type OrbitalPoint = z.infer<typeof OrbitalPointSchema>;
    54→
    55→/**
    56→ * Pass quality rating based on maximum elevation
    57→ */
    58→export const PassQualitySchema = z.enum(["excellent", "good", "fair", "poor"]);
    59→
    60→export type PassQuality = z.infer<typeof PassQualitySchema>;
    61→
    62→/**
    63→ * Derive pass quality from elevation
    64→ */
    65→export function derivePassQuality(maxElevation: number): PassQuality {
    66→	if (maxElevation >= 60) return "excellent";
    67→	if (maxElevation >= 40) return "good";
    68→	if (maxElevation >= 25) return "fair";
    69→	return "poor";
    70→}
    71→
    72→/**
    73→ * Predicted ISS pass for observer location
    74→ */
    75→export const PassPredictionSchema = z.object({
    76→	id: z.string().startsWith("pass-"),
    77→	startTime: z.coerce.date(),
    78→	endTime: z.coerce.date(),
    79→	maxElevation: z.number().min(10).max(90),
    80→	duration: z.number().positive(),
    81→	path: z.array(OrbitalPointSchema).min(2),
    82→	quality: PassQualitySchema,
    83→});
    84→
    85→export type PassPrediction = z.infer<typeof PassPredictionSchema>;
    86→
    87→// =============================================================================
    88→// WEATHER DATA
    89→// =============================================================================
    90→
    91→/**
    92→ * Weather conditions at a point in time
    93→ */
    94→export const WeatherConditionsSchema = z.object({
    95→	timestamp: z.coerce.date(),
    96→	cloudCover: z.number().min(0).max(100),
    97→	visibility: z.number().positive(), // meters
    98→	isFavorable: z.boolean(),
    99→});
   100→
   101→export type WeatherConditions = z.infer<typeof WeatherConditionsSchema>;
   102→
   103→/**
   104→ * Derive weather favorability
   105→ */
   106→export function deriveWeatherFavorability(
   107→	cloudCover: number,
   108→	visibility: number,
   109→): boolean {
   110→	return cloudCover < 50 && visibility > 10000;
   111→}
   112→
   113→/**
   114→ * Open-Meteo API response shape
   115→ */
   116→export const OpenMeteoResponseSchema = z.object({
   117→	latitude: z.number(),
   118→	longitude: z.number(),
   119→	hourly: z.object({
   120→		time: z.array(z.string()),
   121→		cloud_cover: z.array(z.number().nullable()),
   122→		visibility: z.array(z.number().nullable()),
   123→	}),
   124→});
   125→
   126→export type OpenMeteoResponse = z.infer<typeof OpenMeteoResponseSchema>;
   127→
   128→// =============================================================================
   129→// AI BRIEFING
   130→// =============================================================================
   131→
   132→/**
   133→ * Briefing viewing window details
   134→ */
   135→export const ViewingWindowSchema = z.object({
   136→	optimalStart: z.coerce.date(),
   137→	description: z.string().max(150),
   138→});
   139→
   140→export type ViewingWindow = z.infer<typeof ViewingWindowSchema>;
   141→
   142→/**
   143→ * Briefing elevation details
   144→ */
   145→export const ElevationDetailsSchema = z.object({
   146→	max: z.number().min(10).max(90),
   147→	direction: z.string(), // Cardinal direction, e.g., "Northwest"
   148→});
   149→
   150→export type ElevationDetails = z.infer<typeof ElevationDetailsSchema>;
   151→
   152→/**
   153→ * Briefing brightness information
   154→ */
   155→export const BrightnessInfoSchema = z.object({
   156→	magnitude: z.number().min(-4).max(2).optional(),
   157→	description: z.string(), // e.g., "Brighter than Venus"
   158→});
   159→
   160→export type BrightnessInfo = z.infer<typeof BrightnessInfoSchema>;
   161→
   162→/**
   163→ * Weather conditions for briefing
   164→ */
   165→export const BriefingConditionsSchema = z.object({
   166→	cloudCover: z.number().min(0).max(100),
   167→	visibility: z.number().positive(),
   168→	recommendation: z.string().max(200),
   169→});
   170→
   171→export type BriefingConditions = z.infer<typeof BriefingConditionsSchema>;
   172→
   173→/**
   174→ * AI-generated pass briefing
   175→ */
   176→export const PassBriefingSchema = z.object({
   177→	id: z.string(),
   178→	passId: z.string(),
   179→	summary: z.string().max(200),
   180→	narrative: z.string().max(2000),
   181→	viewingWindow: ViewingWindowSchema,
   182→	elevation: ElevationDetailsSchema,
   183→	brightness: BrightnessInfoSchema,
   184→	conditions: BriefingConditionsSchema.optional(),
   185→	tips: z.array(z.string()).min(1).max(5),
   186→	generatedAt: z.number().positive(),
   187→	weatherIncluded: z.boolean(),
   188→});
   189→
   190→export type PassBriefing = z.infer<typeof PassBriefingSchema>;
   191→
   192→/**
   193→ * Stored briefing in IndexedDB (extends PassBriefing with pass data)
   194→ */
   195→export const StoredBriefingSchema = PassBriefingSchema.extend({
   196→	passData: PassPredictionSchema,
   197→});
   198→
   199→export type StoredBriefing = z.infer<typeof StoredBriefingSchema>;
   200→
   201→// =============================================================================
   202→// DATE RANGE
   203→// =============================================================================
   204→
   205→/**
   206→ * Date range for pass listing
   207→ */
   208→export const PassDateRangeSchema = z
   209→	.object({
   210→		startDate: z.coerce.date(),
   211→		endDate: z.coerce.date(),
   212→	})
   213→	.refine((data) => data.endDate > data.startDate, {
   214→		message: "End date must be after start date",
   215→	})
   216→	.refine(
   217→		(data) => {
   218→			const diffDays = Math.ceil(
   219→				(data.endDate.getTime() - data.startDate.getTime()) /
   220→					(1000 * 60 * 60 * 24),
   221→			);
   222→			return diffDays <= 14;
   223→		},
   224→		{
   225→			message: "Date range cannot exceed 14 days",
   226→		},
   227→	);
   228→
   229→export type PassDateRange = z.infer<typeof PassDateRangeSchema>;
   230→
   231→// =============================================================================
   232→// SERVER FUNCTION CONTRACTS
   233→// =============================================================================
   234→
   235→/**
   236→ * Request to generate AI briefing
   237→ */
   238→export const GenerateBriefingRequestSchema = z.object({
   239→	passId: z.string(),
   240→	passData: PassPredictionSchema,
   241→	location: LatLngSchema,
   242→	weather: WeatherConditionsSchema.nullable().optional(),
   243→	includeWeather: z.boolean().default(true),
   244→});
   245→
   246→export type GenerateBriefingRequest = z.infer<
   247→	typeof GenerateBriefingRequestSchema
   248→>;
   249→
   250→/**
   251→ * Response from AI briefing generation
   252→ */
   253→export const GenerateBriefingResponseSchema = z.discriminatedUnion("status", [
   254→	z.object({
   255→		status: z.literal("success"),
   256→		briefing: PassBriefingSchema,
   257→	}),
   258→	z.object({
   259→		status: z.literal("error"),
   260→		error: z.string(),
   261→		fallbackData: PassPredictionSchema.optional(),
   262→	}),
   263→]);
   264→
   265→export type GenerateBriefingResponse = z.infer<
   266→	typeof GenerateBriefingResponseSchema
   267→>;
   268→
   269→/**
   270→ * Request for multiple pass predictions
   271→ */
   272→export const PredictPassesRequestSchema = z.object({
   273→	location: LatLngSchema,
   274→	maxPasses: z.number().min(1).max(20).default(10),
   275→	maxDays: z.number().min(1).max(14).default(7),
   276→	minElevation: z.number().min(5).max(45).default(10),
   277→});
   278→
   279→export type PredictPassesRequest = z.infer<typeof PredictPassesRequestSchema>;
   280→
   281→/**

1→# TanStack DB Research Documentation 2→ 3→**Task**: 003-tanstack-db-migration 4→**Subtask**: 1.1 - Research TanStack DB collection patterns 5→**Date**: 2026-01-02 6→ 7→## Overview 8→ 9→This document captures the research findings for migrating from TanStack Query + Dexie to unified TanStack DB collections with Dexie adapter for reactive, consistent data management. 10→ 11→--- 12→ 13→## 1. Collection Creation Patterns 14→ 15→### Basic Collection Structure 16→ 17→TanStack DB collections combine two packages: 18→- `@tanstack/react-db` - Core collection and query framework 19→- `@tanstack/query-db-collection` - TanStack Query integration 20→ 21→**Standard Pattern**: 22→ 23→```typescript 24→import { createCollection } from "@tanstack/react-db" 25→import { queryCollectionOptions } from "@tanstack/query-db-collection" 26→import { z } from "zod" 27→ 28→const ISSPositionSchema = z.object({ 29→ id: z.string(), 30→ latitude: z.number(), 31→ longitude: z.number(), 32→ timestamp: z.number(), 33→ altitude: z.number(), 34→ velocity: z.number(), 35→ visibility: z.string(), 36→}) 37→ 38→const positionsCollection = createCollection( 39→ queryCollectionOptions({ 40→ queryKey: ["iss", "positions"], 41→ queryFn: async () => { 42→ const response = await fetch("/api/iss/positions") 43→ return response.json() 44→ }, 45→ queryClient, 46→ getKey: (item) => item.id, 47→ schema: ISSPositionSchema, 48→ }) 49→) 50→``` 51→ 52→### Required Parameters 53→ 54→| Parameter | Type | Description | 55→|-----------|------|-------------| 56→| `queryKey` | `string[]` | TanStack Query key identifying cached data | 57→| `queryFn` | `() => Promise` | Async function fetching data from source | 58→| `queryClient` | `QueryClient` | TanStack Query client instance | 59→| `getKey` | `(item: T) => string` | Function extracting unique ID from items | 60→ 61→### Optional Parameters 62→ 63→| Parameter | Type | Description | 64→|-----------|------|-------------| 65→| `schema` | `ZodSchema` | Validates item structure and enables type inference | 66→| `enabled` | `boolean` | Controls automatic query execution | 67→| `refetchInterval` | `number` | Sets polling frequency (milliseconds) | 68→| `staleTime` | `number` | Defines data freshness duration (milliseconds) | 69→| `meta` | `object` | Custom context passed to queryFn | 70→ 71→--- 72→ 73→## 2. Dexie Adapter Configuration 74→ 75→### Installation 76→ 77→The project already has these dependencies installed: 78→```json 79→{ 80→ "@tanstack/query-db-collection": "^0.2.0", 81→ "@tanstack/react-db": "^0.1.1" 82→} 83→``` 84→ 85→**Third-party Dexie Adapter**: 86→```bash 87→npm install tanstack-dexie-db-collection 88→``` 89→ 90→### Dexie Collection Pattern 91→ 92→The `tanstack-dexie-db-collection` package provides `dexieCollectionOptions()` for IndexedDB persistence: 93→ 94→```typescript 95→import { createCollection } from "@tanstack/react-db" 96→import { dexieCollectionOptions } from "tanstack-dexie-db-collection" 97→import { z } from "zod" 98→ 99→const todoSchema = z.object({ 100→ id: z.string(), 101→ text: z.string(), 102→ completed: z.boolean(), 103→}) 104→ 105→const todosCollection = createCollection( 106→ dexieCollectionOptions({ 107→ id: "todos", 108→ schema: todoSchema, 109→ getKey: (item) => item.id, 110→ }) 111→) 112→``` 113→ 114→### Dexie Configuration Options 115→ 116→| Option | Type | Default | Description | 117→|--------|------|---------|-------------| 118→| `id` | `string` | **required** | Unique collection identifier (also table name) | 119→| `getKey` | `function` | **required** | Extracts unique key from items | 120→| `schema` | `ZodSchema` | **required** | Enables type inference and validation | 121→| `dbName` | `string` | `'app-db'` | Database name in IndexedDB | 122→| `tableName` | `string` | `id` value | Dexie table name (defaults to id) | 123→| `syncBatchSize` | `number` | `1000` | Items loaded per batch during sync | 124→| `rowUpdateMode` | `'partial' \| 'full'` | `'partial'` | Update strategy (partial merge vs full replace) | 125→| `ackTimeoutMs` | `number` | `2000` | Acknowledgment tracking window | 126→| `awaitTimeoutMs` | `number` | `10000` | ID waiting period timeout | 127→ 128→### Data Transformation with Codec 129→ 130→Transform data between storage and in-memory formats: 131→ 132→```typescript 133→codec: { 134→ parse: (stored) => ({ 135→ ...stored, 136→ date: new Date(stored.date) 137→ }), 138→ serialize: (item) => ({ 139→ ...item, 140→ date: item.date.toISOString() 141→ }) 142→} 143→``` 144→ 145→### Lazy Initialization Pattern 146→ 147→For Cloudflare Workers compatibility (matches existing `db.ts` pattern): 148→ 149→```typescript 150→// Shared Dexie database instance 151→let _db: Dexie | null = null 152→ 153→function getDb(): Dexie { 154→ if (typeof window === "undefined") { 155→ throw new Error("Database can only be accessed in browser environment") 156→ } 157→ 158→ if (!_db) { 159→ _db = new Dexie("ephemeris-iss") 160→ _db.version(1).stores({ 161→ positions: "id, timestamp", 162→ crew: "id, fetchedAt", 163→ tle: "id, fetchedAt", 164→ briefings: "passId, timestamp", 165→ }) 166→ } 167→ 168→ return _db 169→} 170→ 171→// Create collection with lazy DB initialization 172→const positionsCollection = createCollection( 173→ dexieCollectionOptions({ 174→ id: "positions", 175→ schema: ISSPositionSchema, 176→ getKey: (item) => item.id, 177→ dbName: "ephemeris-iss", 178→ tableName: "positions", 179→ }) 180→) 181→``` 182→ 183→### Utility Methods 184→ 185→Access helpers via `collection.utils`: 186→ 187→```typescript 188→// Direct Dexie table access 189→const table = positionsCollection.utils.getTable() 190→ 191→// Force live query refresh 192→positionsCollection.utils.refresh() 193→ 194→// Async refresh with processing guarantee 195→await positionsCollection.utils.refetch() 196→ 197→// Generate sequential IDs (auto-initializes from max) 198→const nextId = await positionsCollection.utils.getNextId() 199→ 200→// Bulk insert from server (bootstrap) 201→await positionsCollection.utils.bulkInsertLocally(items) 202→``` 203→ 204→--- ## ✅ Subtask 2.1 Complete

I've successfully implemented the ISS position sync handler. Here's what was created:

### Implementation Summary

**File Created:** `src/lib/iss/sync/position-sync.ts`

**Key Features:**
1. **`syncPosition()`** - Core sync function that:
   - Fetches ISS position from API using existing `fetchISSPosition()`
   - Inserts position into `positionsCollection`
   - Triggers reactive updates for all `useLiveQuery` hooks
   - Returns typed sync result (`SyncSuccess | SyncError`)

2. **`startPositionSync(intervalMs)`** - Lifecycle management:
   - Performs initial sync immediately
   - Sets up background interval (default: 5 seconds)
   - Returns cleanup function to stop sync

3. **Error Handling:**
   - Graceful error catching with typed result objects
   - Non-blocking errors that won't crash the app
   - Detailed error information for debugging

4. **Type Safety:**
   - Full TypeScript support with explicit return types
   - Zod schema validation via collection
   - Proper error type handling

### Acceptance Criteria ✓

- [x] Sync handler fetches from ISS API
- [x] Inserts/updates position in collection
- [x] Handles errors gracefully
- [x] Configurable refresh interval

- Follows patterns from `research.md`: ✓
- Matches codebase style: ✓
- Clean commit created: ✓ (64ad5fd)

entries.detail:
1→/**
     2→ * ISS Crew Sync Handler
     3→ *
     4→ * Fetches ISS crew data from API and inserts into TanStack DB collection.
     5→ * Provides background sync with configurable intervals for reactive updates.
     6→ */
     7→
     8→import { fetchCrewData } from "@/lib/iss/api";
     9→import { crewCollection } from "@/lib/iss/collections/crew";
    10→
    11→// =============================================================================
    12→// SYNC CONFIGURATION
    13→// =============================================================================
    14→
    15→/**
    16→ * Default crew sync interval in milliseconds
    17→ * Crew changes infrequently, so we refresh every hour
    18→ */
    19→export const DEFAULT_CREW_SYNC_INTERVAL = 3600000; // 1 hour
    20→
    21→// =============================================================================
    22→// SYNC RESULT TYPES
    23→// =============================================================================
    24→
    25→interface SyncSuccess {
    26→	success: true;
    27→	timestamp: number;
    28→	crewCount: number;
    29→	crew: Array<{ id: string; name: string }>;
    30→}
    31→
    32→interface SyncError {
    33→	success: false;
    34→	error: Error;
    35→	timestamp: number;
    36→}
    37→
    38→type SyncResult = SyncSuccess | SyncError;
    39→
    40→// =============================================================================
    41→// SYNC HANDLER
    42→// =============================================================================
    43→
    44→/**
    45→ * Sync current ISS crew from API to collection
    46→ *
    47→ * Fetches the latest crew data and bulk inserts it into the crew collection.
    48→ * Adds fetchedAt timestamp to track data freshness.
    49→ * This triggers reactive updates for all useLiveQuery hooks watching the collection.
    50→ *
    51→ * @returns Promise resolving to sync result with success status
    52→ */
    53→export async function syncCrew(): Promise<SyncResult> {
    54→	try {
    55→		const crew = await fetchCrewData();
    56→		const fetchedAt = Date.now();
    57→
    58→		// Add fetchedAt timestamp to each astronaut record
    59→		const storedCrew = crew.map((astronaut) => ({
    60→			...astronaut,
    61→			fetchedAt,
    62→		}));
    63→
    64→		// Bulk insert into collection (triggers useLiveQuery updates)
    65→		// Insert each crew member individually to ensure proper collection handling
    66→		for (const astronaut of storedCrew) {
    67→			await crewCollection.insert(astronaut);
    68→		}
    69→
    70→		return {
    71→			success: true,
    72→			timestamp: fetchedAt,
    73→			crewCount: crew.length,
    74→			crew: crew.map((a) => ({ id: a.id, name: a.name })),
    75→		};
    76→	} catch (error) {
    77→		return {
    78→			success: false,
    79→			error: error instanceof Error ? error : new Error(String(error)),
    80→			timestamp: Date.now(),
    81→		};
    82→	}
    83→}
    84→
    85→// =============================================================================
    86→// SYNC LIFECYCLE
    87→// =============================================================================
    88→
    89→/**
    90→ * Start background crew sync with interval
    91→ *
    92→ * Performs initial sync immediately, then continues on interval.
    93→ * Returns cleanup function to stop the sync.
    94→ *
    95→ * @param intervalMs - Sync interval in milliseconds (default: 3600000 = 1 hour)
    96→ * @returns Cleanup function to stop sync
    97→ *
    98→ * @example
    99→ * ```typescript
   100→ * // Start syncing every hour
   101→ * const stopSync = startCrewSync()
   102→ *
   103→ * // Later, stop the sync
   104→ * stopSync()
   105→ * ```
   106→ */
   107→export function startCrewSync(
   108→	intervalMs: number = DEFAULT_CREW_SYNC_INTERVAL,
   109→): () => void {
   110→	// Initial sync (fire and forget)
   111→	syncCrew();
   112→
   113→	// Background sync
   114→	const intervalId = setInterval(() => {
   115→		syncCrew();
   116→	}, intervalMs);
   117→
   118→	// Return cleanup function
   119→	return () => clearInterval(intervalId);
   120→}
   121→

### Created File
- **`src/lib/iss/sync/tle-sync.ts`** - TLE sync handler implementation

### Key Features Implemented

1. **Multi-source fallback chain**: CelesTrak → ARISS → Hardcoded fallback

2. **`src/lib/iss/sync/index.ts`** - Central exports for all sync functionality

### Key Features Implemented:

**Sync Manager (`createSyncManager`)**:
- Coordinates all three sync handlers (position, crew, TLE)
- Configurable intervals with sensible defaults:
  - Position: 5 seconds
  - Crew: 1 hour
  - TLE: 1 hour
- **Start/Stop lifecycle methods** for managing all syncs together
- **Visibility change handling** - automatically pauses syncing when tab is hidden and resumes when visible to save resources
- Singleton pattern via `getDefaultSyncManager()` for simple use cases

**Architecture**:
- Clean factory pattern for creating manager instances
- Returns cleanup functions for proper resource management
- Type-safe configuration with TypeScript interfaces
- Follows exact same patterns as existing sync handlers

## ✅ Subtask 3.1 Completed Successfully!

I've successfully implemented the **useISSPositionDB** hook using TanStack DB's `useLiveQuery` for reactive position data.

### What Was Implemented

**File Created**: `src/hooks/iss/useISSDataDB.ts`

**Key Features**:
- ✅ **Reactive Queries**: Uses TanStack DB `useLiveQuery` to automatically update when the positions collection changes
- ✅ **Latest Position**: Queries the most recent position by ordering by timestamp descending and using `findOne()`
- ✅ **Compatible Interface**: Maintains backward compatibility with the existing `UseISSPositionResult` interface
- ✅ **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript support with Zod schema validation
- ✅ **Instant Loading**: Loads directly from IndexedDB with no network delay
- ✅ **Reactive Updates**: Automatically updates UI when sync handler inserts new positions

### Implementation Details

The hook follows the TanStack DB patterns from the research document:

```typescript
export function useISSPositionDB(): UseISSPositionResult {
  const query = useLiveQuery((q) =>
    q
      .from({ pos: positionsCollection })
      .orderBy(({ pos }) => pos.timestamp, "desc")
      .findOne(),
  );

  return {
    data: query.data ?? null,
    isLoading: query.isLoading,
    fromCache: true, // DB collections always serve from cache
    isFetching: query.isLoading,
    error: query.isError ? new Error("Failed to query position collection") : null,
  };
}
```

### Verification Results

✅ **TypeScript Compilation**: Passed (no new errors)  
✅ **Production Build**: Succeeded in 4.02s  
✅ **Git Commit**: `1e30e2f` - Changes committed successfully  
✅ **Implementation Plan**: Updated to mark subtask 3.1 as completed  

### Quality Checklist

- ✅ Follows patterns from reference files (research.md, positions.ts, sync handler)
- ✅ No console.log/print debugging statements
- ✅ Error handling in place (converts isError to Error | null)
- ✅ Verification passes (TypeScript + build)
- ✅ Clean commit with descriptive message

### Next Steps

The hook is ready for integration! Next subtasks in Phase 3:
- **3.2**: Create useISSCrewDB hook with live query
- **3.3**: Create useISSTLEDB hook with live query
- **3.4**: Create usePositionHistoryDB hook with collection query
- **3.5**: Create useBriefingDB hooks with live query

entries.detail:
1→# TanStack DB Research Documentation
     2→
     3→**Task**: 003-tanstack-db-migration
     4→**Subtask**: 1.1 - Research TanStack DB collection patterns
     5→**Date**: 2026-01-02
     6→
     7→## Overview
     8→
     9→This document captures the research findings for migrating from TanStack Query + Dexie to unified TanStack DB collections with Dexie adapter for reactive, consistent data management.
    10→
    11→---
    12→
    13→## 1. Collection Creation Patterns
    14→
    15→### Basic Collection Structure
    16→
    17→TanStack DB collections combine two packages:
    18→- `@tanstack/react-db` - Core collection and query framework
    19→- `@tanstack/query-db-collection` - TanStack Query integration
    20→
    21→**Standard Pattern**:
    22→
    23→```typescript
    24→import { createCollection } from "@tanstack/react-db"
    25→import { queryCollectionOptions } from "@tanstack/query-db-collection"
    26→import { z } from "zod"
    27→
    28→const ISSPositionSchema = z.object({
    29→  id: z.string(),
    30→  latitude: z.number(),
    31→  longitude: z.number(),
    32→  timestamp: z.number(),
    33→  altitude: z.number(),
    34→  velocity: z.number(),
    35→  visibility: z.string(),
    36→})
    37→
    38→const positionsCollection = createCollection(
    39→  queryCollectionOptions({
    40→    queryKey: ["iss", "positions"],
    41→    queryFn: async () => {
    42→      const response = await fetch("/api/iss/positions")
    43→      return response.json()
    44→    },
    45→    queryClient,
    46→    getKey: (item) => item.id,
    47→    schema: ISSPositionSchema,
    48→  })
    49→)
    50→```
    51→
    52→### Required Parameters
    53→
    54→| Parameter | Type | Description |
    55→|-----------|------|-------------|
    56→| `queryKey` | `string[]` | TanStack Query key identifying cached data |
    57→| `queryFn` | `() => Promise<T[]>` | Async function fetching data from source |
    58→| `queryClient` | `QueryClient` | TanStack Query client instance |
    59→| `getKey` | `(item: T) => string` | Function extracting unique ID from items |
    60→
    61→### Optional Parameters
    62→
    63→| Parameter | Type | Description |
    64→|-----------|------|-------------|
    65→| `schema` | `ZodSchema` | Validates item structure and enables type inference |
    66→| `enabled` | `boolean` | Controls automatic query execution |
    67→| `refetchInterval` | `number` | Sets polling frequency (milliseconds) |
    68→| `staleTime` | `number` | Defines data freshness duration (milliseconds) |
    69→| `meta` | `object` | Custom context passed to queryFn |
    70→
    71→---
    72→
    73→## 2. Dexie Adapter Configuration
    74→
    75→### Installation
    76→
    77→The project already has these dependencies installed:
    78→```json
    79→{
    80→  "@tanstack/query-db-collection": "^0.2.0",
    81→  "@tanstack/react-db": "^0.1.1"
    82→}
    83→```
    84→
    85→**Third-party Dexie Adapter**:
    86→```bash
    87→npm install tanstack-dexie-db-collection
    88→```
    89→
    90→### Dexie Collection Pattern
    91→
    92→The `tanstack-dexie-db-collection` package provides `dexieCollectionOptions()` for IndexedDB persistence:
    93→
    94→```typescript
    95→import { createCollection } from "@tanstack/react-db"
    96→import { dexieCollectionOptions } from "tanstack-dexie-db-collection"
    97→import { z } from "zod"
    98→
    99→const todoSchema = z.object({
   100→  id: z.string(),
   101→  text: z.string(),
   102→  completed: z.boolean(),
   103→})
   104→
   105→const todosCollection = createCollection(
   106→  dexieCollectionOptions({
   107→    id: "todos",
   108→    schema: todoSchema,
   109→    getKey: (item) => item.id,
   110→  })
   111→)
   112→```
   113→
   114→### Dexie Configuration Options
   115→
   116→| Option | Type | Default | Description |
   117→|--------|------|---------|-------------|
   118→| `id` | `string` | **required** | Unique collection identifier (also table name) |
   119→| `getKey` | `function` | **required** | Extracts unique key from items |
   120→| `schema` | `ZodSchema` | **required** | Enables type inference and validation |
   121→| `dbName` | `string` | `'app-db'` | Database name in IndexedDB |
   122→| `tableName` | `string` | `id` value | Dexie table name (defaults to id) |
   123→| `syncBatchSize` | `number` | `1000` | Items loaded per batch during sync |
   124→| `rowUpdateMode` | `'partial' \| 'full'` | `'partial'` | Update strategy (partial merge vs full replace) |
   125→| `ackTimeoutMs` | `number` | `2000` | Acknowledgment tracking window |
   126→| `awaitTimeoutMs` | `number` | `10000` | ID waiting period timeout |
   127→
   128→### Data Transformation with Codec
   129→
   130→Transform data between storage and in-memory formats:
   131→
   132→```typescript
   133→codec: {
   134→  parse: (stored) => ({
   135→    ...stored,
   136→    date: new Date(stored.date)
   137→  }),
   138→  serialize: (item) => ({
   139→    ...item,
   140→    date: item.date.toISOString()
   141→  })
   142→}
   143→```
   144→
   145→### Lazy Initialization Pattern
   146→
   147→For Cloudflare Workers compatibility (matches existing `db.ts` pattern):
   148→
   149→```typescript
   150→// Shared Dexie database instance
   151→let _db: Dexie | null = null
   152→
   153→function getDb(): Dexie {
   154→  if (typeof window === "undefined") {
   155→    throw new Error("Database can only be accessed in browser environment")
   156→  }
   157→
   158→  if (!_db) {
   159→    _db = new Dexie("ephemeris-iss")
   160→    _db.version(1).stores({
   161→      positions: "id, timestamp",
   162→      crew: "id, fetchedAt",
   163→      tle: "id, fetchedAt",
   164→      briefings: "passId, timestamp",
   165→    })
   166→  }
   167→
   168→  return _db
   169→}
   170→
   171→// Create collection with lazy DB initialization
   172→const positionsCollection = createCollection(
   173→  dexieCollectionOptions({
   174→    id: "positions",
   175→    schema: ISSPositionSchema,
   176→    getKey: (item) => item.id,
   177→    dbName: "ephemeris-iss",
   178→    tableName: "positions",
   179→  })
   180→)
   181→```
   182→
   183→### Utility Methods
   184→
   185→Access helpers via `collection.utils`:
   186→
   187→```typescript
   188→// Direct Dexie table access
   189→const table = positionsCollection.utils.getTable()
   190→
   191→// Force live query refresh
   192→positionsCollection.utils.refresh()
   193→
   194→// Async refresh with processing guarantee
   195→await positionsCollection.utils.refetch()
   196→
   197→// Generate sequential IDs (auto-initializes from max)
   198→const nextId = await positionsCollection.utils.getNextId()
   199→
